URI naming convention

Material from the research done within the GLD WG
URI-guidelines
En español, salvo
* se diga lo contrario
* ontology y resource en inglés
Next, we present the basic URI naming convention we follow
For the model:
http://DomainOrProject.linkeddata.es/ontology/
http://DomainOrProject.linkeddata.es/ontology/ClassName (for Concepts)
http://DomainOrProject.linkeddata.es/ontology/property (for Properties)
for example:
http://edu.linkeddata.es/ontology/
http://geo.linkeddata.es/ontology/
http://webenemasuno.linkeddata.es/ontology/
optionally we can be more specific and include a particular domain
for example:
http://edu.linkeddata.es/ontology/Investigaci%C3%B3n/
For the RDF resource (instances)
http://DomainOrProject.linkeddata.es/resource/ResourceType/Resource
for example:
http://edu.linkeddata.es/resource/Investigador/RichardCyganiak
http://geo.linkeddata.es/resource/Departamento/Cochabamba
URI Ecoding

When generating URIs from non-english text strings, you may violate some of the URI specifications for character encoding. The best way to ensure that your URI are properly generated is using the following code:
String uri = new URI(null, "http://geo.linkeddata.es/ontology/Geometría Compuesta", null).toASCIIString();
uri = uri.replaceAll(",", "%2C");
uri = uri.replaceAll("'", "%27");
uri = uri.replaceAll("\\(", "%28");
uri = uri.replaceAll("\\)", "%29");
uri = uri.replaceAll("%23", "#");
A thread about this in the Jena mailing list:
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/jena-dev/message/46883
Linking

LinkingLD
Silk

To compare instances of classes with special chars in their URIs
1. First work around
....
  <RestrictTo>
          ?a rdf:type ?type. FILTER(REGEX(STR(?type),"http://geo.linkeddata.es/ontology/R%C3%ADo")).
   </RestrictTo>
   ....
2. Second work around
...
 <RestrictTo>
     ?a rdf:type <http://geo.linkeddata.es/ontology/R%C3%ADo>.
 </RestrictTo>
 ...
To process the input to compare
...
     <Input path="?a/rdfs:label" /> <!-- primer input -->
     <TransformInput function="lowerCase">  <!-- second input -->
	<Input path="?b/rdfs:label[@lang='es']" />
     </TransformInput>                      
...
Useful Material

Recomended reading:
Book: Linked Data, Evolving the Web into a Global Data Space. Tom Heath, Christian Bizer
Article: Linked Data - The Story So Far. Bizer, C., Heath, T., Berners-Lee, T.
Some ideas

The five pilot sites in Spain – the regions of Andalusia, the Balearic Islands, Castile-La Mancha, Catalonia and Valencia – are world-famous holiday destinations attracting millions of visitors every year. Due to intense tourism, which is subject to significant seasonal fluctuations in both the city and the seaside, a large number of incoming patients are expected to arrive especially in Andalusia, the Balearic Islands, Catalonia and Valencia.
